definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

sentences.english: There is diligent spirit and team cooperation consciousness, obey an upper grade leadership.
sentences.chinese: 有食用苦耐勞的精神和團隊協作意識，服從上級領導。

sentences.english: School leaders are the bridges between upper leaders and school staff.
sentences.chinese: 學校領導者是上級領導和學校羣衆之間的中介人。

sentences.english: Works with Superior on manpower planning and management needs.
sentences.chinese: 與上級領導一起進行人力規劃和管理需求。

sentences.english: Fulfil the other temporary task assigned by the leader.
sentences.chinese: 完成上級領導臨時指派的任務。

sentences.english: Accomplish the task from the leader.
sentences.chinese: 完成上級領導分配的其他任務。

sentences.english: Responsible for the temporary work distributed by upper leaders.
sentences.chinese: 完成上級領導交辦的臨時性工作。

sentences.english: According to regulations, the higher-ups to check the need to wear a helmet before they can enter.
sentences.chinese: 按規定，上級領導來檢查必須戴好安全帽纔可以進入。

sentences.english: Implement the temporary work assigned by the immediate superior.
sentences.chinese: 完成上級領導臨時指派的任務。

sentences.english: Hold the briefing carefully before the shift started, pass the hotel management team's instructions.
sentences.chinese: 值班前認真召開班前會，傳達上級領導的指示。
